featherflight moduleÔÉÅ

This is the main module of the FeatherFlight class. The FeatherFlight is a class that has been developed by the data team at FeatherFlight Inc. to get a better understanding of all our flights and drive the sustainable transition in our company.

class featherflight.FeatherFlight(*, data_source: str = 'https://gitlab.com/adpro1/adpro2024/-/raw/main/Files/flight_data.zip?inline=false', creation_date: date = datetime.date(2024, 3, 16), airlines: DataFrame = None, airplanes: DataFrame = None, airports: DataFrame = None, routes: DataFrame = None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: BaseModel

Class to get a better understanding of all our flights and drive the sustainable transition in our company.

aircraft_info(aircraft_name: str) → strÔÉÅ

Get information about an aircraft model with the use of OpenAI GPT-3.5-Turbo language model.

Parameters:

aircraft_name (str) ‚Äì Name of the aircraft model

Returns:

Information about the aircraft model

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError ‚Äì If the aircraft name is not in the airplanes dataset

Returns:

list of unique airplane models

Return type:

list

calculate_distances_routes() → NoneÔÉÅ

Calculate the distances between the source and destination airports for each route.

Returns:

A new column ‚Äòdistance_km‚Äô is added to the routes dataframe. The coordinates of the source and destination airports are also added to the routes dataframe.

Return type:

None

model_computed_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}ÔÉÅ

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {'arbitrary_types_allowed': True}ÔÉÅ

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'airlines': FieldInfo(annotation=DataFrame, required=False), 'airplanes': FieldInfo(annotation=DataFrame, required=False), 'airports': FieldInfo(annotation=DataFrame, required=False), 'creation_date': FieldInfo(annotation=date, required=False, default=datetime.date(2024, 3, 16)), 'data_source': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=False, default='https://gitlab.com/adpro1/adpro2024/-/raw/main/Files/flight_data.zip?inline=false'), 'routes': FieldInfo(annotation=DataFrame, required=False)}ÔÉÅ

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

plot_flights(airport: str, internal: bool = False) → NoneÔÉÅ

Plot flights leaving the given airport.

Parameters:

  • airport (str) ‚Äì The airport IATA code.

  • internal (bool) ‚Äì Whether to plot internal flights only. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A plot of the flights leaving the given airport is displayed.

Return type:

None

plot_flights_from_country(country: str, internal: bool = False, cutoff: float = 1000) → NoneÔÉÅ

Plots all flights leaving from a given country to all other countries or only internal flights. Uses geopandas and matplotlib.

Parameters:

  • country (str) ‚Äì Country name

  • internal (bool, optional) ‚Äì Plot internal flights only. Defaults to False.

  • cutoff (float, optional) ‚Äì Cutoff distance for short haul flights. Defaults to 1000.

Returns:

Plot of flights from the given country

Return type:

None

Raises:

AssertionError ‚Äì If the given country name is not in the airports dataset

plot_top_airplane_models(countries: str = None, n_models: int = 5) → NoneÔÉÅ

Plot the n most used airplane models by number of routes.

Parameters:

  • countries (str or list of str) ‚Äì A country or a list of countries to filter the routes. Defaults to None.

  • n_models (int) ‚Äì Number of airplane models to plot. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

A bar plot of the n most used airplane models by number of routes is displayed.

Return type:

None
